Iâ€™ve chosen a word since 2008 to be the anthem of my new year. This yearâ€™s word is Present. I find it hard to be present a lot of times because Iâ€™m distracted, and not just by life in general, but by other peopleâ€™s lives via social media. I spend so many hours a day on it and not just because itâ€™s my job, but because Iâ€™m intrigued and curious. Or bored. Or perhaps just nosey. Maybe all of the above. I love social media for the connection point, and I value the inclusiveness, but I recognise that my attachment to it has become grossly consuming on my end, so much so that Iâ€™m neglecting my own family to log in to know more about other peopleâ€™s lives instead. So here is a picture of my family so you can see who I will be spending most of my time and attention on this year. Donâ€™t worry- Iâ€™ll still be posting about Toons, I just need to limit how much time I spend on it personally. Happy New Year from our family to yours! Thank you for tracking with us all of these years! We are grateful for you all! Xx

This photo was taken the night before my mom had a massive stroke (due to cancer complications) and then one week later, on Dec 13, 2017, she passed away. She adored Tuna (as you can see) and he brought her so much joy, especially as she battled cancer. She also loved how much joy he brought all of you! She talked about it often. In honour of her, would you mind telling me in a comment how and/or why Tuna melts your heart? It can be simple or a testimony of something specific. I think reading what you say will be helpful for my heart today and throughout this holiday season. Loosing your parent sucks, especially over Christmas. I stand with you all who have experienced something similar. Love you all.

I've learned a lot from social media in the 5 years that I've had this account, and one of the main things that I have been taught is that it is a powerful platform of influence. We can either choose to use it as a platform to provoke fear, bullying and hate, or we can use it as a platform to promote peace, love, joy and hope. I'm not discounting disappointment, but I must say, that I am so encouraged by all of the accounts that are choosing to use it as the latter. No matter our differences of opinions, as a nation, it is important that we stand united and not divided. Do not be driven by fear and divided by hate. It is no use to partner with those things and it only worsens circumstances. So here is my best attempt at making you all smile and to encourage you that if you are being riddled with anxiety from accounts that are filling your minds with despair and fear, you've come to a place where you'll find none of that. #united ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸

Fun fact about Tuna's name: When I first adopted him, his rescuer called him Wormy because he would worm on his belly instead of walking. I changed his name to Mr. Burns after Montgomery Burns of the Simpsons per their uncanny resemblance. His nickname became Tooney, which is short for cartoon, and that morphed into Tuna, which stuck and is now his formal name. However, a lot of people think that his name is Phteven, after a meme of him with that name went viral. That being said, he goes by a lot of names and has a million more nicknames than I mentioned. Ps: His middle name is Marie. That's for another story.

I've always had so much respect for @thebodyshop's commitment and passion to end animal testing on product, so we are teaming up with them to help them reach their goal of collecting 8 million signatures on their petition to ban animal testing in cosmetics! I'm sorry for my lack of posting. This weekend we took an "us" trip to (amazing) Stockholm, and I stayed away purposefully from social media in order to be intentionally present with my husband. We left London the same morning of the tragic bombing at Parsons Green station, and I've been processing it ever since. When we found out, we were shocked because Parsons Green is the tube stop that we frequent often whilst in London, and it's the station directly across the street from the place where I met my husband 2.5 years ago, where he worked. It's also the place where we had our engagement drinks and where we celebrated our marriage (9 months later) with our London friends just a few weeks ago. It's very familiar, and hits close to home. The realisation that something like this could happen in quiet Parsons Green- can happen anywhere for that matter- just breaks my heart at how unpredictable life is. That's why I've been processing the importance of being present and not always distracted by my iPhone. I just needed a little break. Ps: I love you Londontown! You're my, and Tuna's second home. â¤ï¸ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ğŸ™ Pps: Can't wait to be back with my sweet baby Toons in 4 days!

Since our last post, a lot of you are asking how I taught Tuna to "fuff." Well, I guess the trick is, when your dog barks, tell him or her no, and immediately replace the bark by making a "tfuff" sound yourself. Do this over and over again, and maybe they'll catch on! Tuna certainly did over time. PS: I just took this video minutes ago to give you a "fuffing" tutorial. Haha. This is a thing in our house.

I had an idea last night! Letâ€™s all spread the word HARD about #adoptdontshop. I challenge EVERYONE, today or tomorrow, to post on your own page (including stories) about the importance of adopting and fostering (all ages, all conditions). Get creative with your posts and your captions. As you may know, Vine is changing tomorrow. That may not be a big deal for some of you, but it actually makes me super sad. Tuna's mom speaking "real talk" here on this lovely #tunartuesdays afternoon. I feel like I keep coming up against a theme lately called process. I'm learning that good things take time. That when I have a microwaveable-mindset and expect things to be ready or different in a minute's time instead of just marinating, and waiting for the right timing, I grow impatient and make decisions out of haste, and on impulse. I'm finding that there's beauty in process and I want to start appreciating it more and get better at being patient in the meantime. I guess you could say I'm in process with that ğŸ˜‰ Who's with me? #tunainterpretations| @finelinecards

I used to say to God often
type: ""I want to be used to change the world!"" but I didn't know how
post_url: or with what platform of influence. I certainly didn't think it would be through a little #shrivelneck dog. What I've come to find out is that I am by no means changing the world through Tuna's social platforms
timestamp: it is apparent that we are being used as catalysts to change people's days....all over the world! That fact humbles me and makes me so proud to be this little ones momma
date: and I can't stop and won't stop thanking God for hearing (and answering) my requests ğŸ˜ƒ #HappyMothersDay (again) to every kind of momma!"

caption: {Part 1} At 34, I never would have thought that my child would be a precious, little dog with a #shrivelneck. Furthermore, I never would have thought that I actually enjoy giving his #shrivelneck what seems to be a million kisses throughout the day. And I certainly never would have imagined that there would be close to 2 million people who appreciated his #shrivelneck as much as I do! I am so humbled to be this one's momma, and I'm so grateful that I get to be a part of his story...and I'm even more humbled and grateful that he gets to be a part of some of yours! ğŸ˜ƒ Thank you all for loving Tuna as much as I do! #HappyMothersDay to every kind of momma out there.

caption: "So tell me what you want, what you really really want?" Well, Tuna and I wanted some R&R after the book tour so we stayed at the incredibly beautiful @StPancrasRen in London renowned for this gorgeous staircase featured in the Spice Girls video for "Wannabe." The hotel is attached to St Pancras train station (which is my favourite), and the property is over and beyond pet-friendly! They offer a private masterclass course where I learned more about Tuna's personality/temperament whilst he attempted to learn how to skate board (picture to follow.) Thanks for a great stay @StPancrasRen! We will definitely be back!

5 years ago today I met this little fellow at a Farmers Market in Los Angeles. He was a tiny and toothless, insecure, unloved 4-month old puppy at the time. I took him home that day with the intentions to foster him, but he melted my heart so instead, came home to live with me permanently (2 weeks later. There's a story for that for another time :) There are so many furry friends in need of a home just like Tuna did. I encourage you to foster or adopt and if you can't do either, please donate to your local shelter. Every home and every penny makes a huge difference to the lives of these cuties. #babytuna

You may have been noticing that today is #NationalDogDay, so let's celebrate by raising awareness and financial support for rescue organizations!!! You can help homeless dogs around the country by sharing a picture and a short story of your pup at MyRescue.dog. Each picture posted on that site generates a $10 donation to PetFinder Foundation and then you can vote on your favorite pup, with each vote generating a $1 donation, up to $100,000! Today is our dear friend, Sammi's 5th birthday! Over the weekend her precious family threw her a Tuna-themed birthday party which included "pin the teeth on Tuna." Sammi was born with a congenial bone disorder called Osteogenesis Imperfecta, also known as Brittle Bone Disease, where she is prone to fractures. We met her at our Austin book signing back in March and both Tuna and I fell in love with her immediately because she has the sweetest spirit. She has become a close friend of ours and brings us both so much joy! Here's to you sweet Sammi! Happy birthday my love. Thank you to @madelineaudrey for this sweet #tunainterpretations of Tuna and Sammi! #tunartuesdays

Hypothetical questions about the #ADollarADog ThanksGIVING campaign. Q: How do I donate? A: Visit ruv.me/adollaradog Q: Do I have to donate? A: Nope. Please just help spread the word through your social platforms and include the website. Q: Can I donate if I live outside of the US? A: For sure!! All currencies are accepted. Q: Can I donate more than $1? A: Absolutely! You automatically start with a dollar, and you have 4 options to donate, up to $100. Q: What if I want to donate more than a $100? A: You can! Just email info@yougive1.com and they will send you a link to donate more. Q: Can I nominate different people every time I post? A: Please do! That is encouraged! Q: Will you be posting about this everyday until Friday, because it's getting a little annoying. A: One million%!! Sorry if I'm being redundant but this is super important. #sorrynotsorry #adollaradog #pawitforward ğŸ¾ #barkcam

caption: When Tuna hit a million followers on @instagram, one follower suggested using his platform to raise money for animal shelters. We thought that was a BRILLIANT IDEA but it would be even better if it was a COLLABORATIVE EFFORT! Over the next 5 days, if everyone donated a dollar AND spread the word to your audiences to do the same, together, we could make a HUGE impact for the animal rescue community! While we would love to benefit every group in the universe that is helping animals in need, we chose to support 8 rescue groups that could use more awareness. Please visit, ruv.me/adollaradog for the ThanksGIVING campaign details, and to learn more about the 8 rescue groups we are supporting! *100% of all proceeds raised will be divided up to benefit the 8 rescue groups. #ADollarADog #PawItForward ğŸ’µğŸ¶

Meet Sandy! Tuna's new buddy. #BarkPack is celebrating the release of Sony's @AnnieMovie coming out December 19th and came up with a brilliant idea to create awareness for rescue since the dog who plays Sandy in the movie is a rescue! If you post a photo of your pup wearing a red bow, hashtag #ImARescueToo, tell your story how your pup rescued you in the caption, and tag 3 friends to do the same, @BarkBox + Sony will donate $1 to the @ASPCA for each submission! Love that! So here's how Tuna rescued me: He helped redefine my purpose. What I mean by that is, I never expected any of this to happen. However, I love people & animals so much, so by having an outlet like @instagram, I am able to connect with all of you globally, and create awareness for animal rescue! Without Tuna, and without your love for him, none of this would be possible. I appreciate you all so much! ğŸ˜˜ Now keep spreading love and awareness for our furry friends in need!

Tuna is always super concerned that I'm going to invite Leroy to live with us because he knows my affinity for squirrels, so he's constantly looking outside to make sure that Leroy stays put in his natural habitat. #YouThinkImKidding #ButImBeingSerious

Today is recognized as #worldkindnessday, however, I think that "kindness" should be the anthem of everyday. You can easily become the catalyst to change the trajectory of a persons day by simply being kind to them. Start by smiling or by saying hello. Your kindness may be exactly what they need to feel loved and to be seen. Therefore, I charge you to start practicing kindness by being mindful with your words and intentional with your actions. Make an effort to love others with greatness because it is more gratifying to build someone up than to tear them down. #BeADayChanger #BeKind

caption: Sometimes when we take car rides, and I'm the passenger, he thinks I'm his dog bed. Scratch that. "Sometimes" is understatement. It's more like one million percent of time, or in other words, always.

When I joined Instagram back in November 2011 I had no agenda to garner a large following. However, I quickly realized that Tuna's photo's were bringing people a lot of joy and laughter, so I decided to continue to feature a photo a day. While there have been days when I've posted multiple pictures, and days when I haven't posted at all, I've tried my best to stay as consistent as possible. So here's to his 1,000 post, and it also happens to be the first photo that I've ever put up on Instagram ğŸ˜„ #nostalgiclittletoodlebrain
Good grief man! That hoodie looks rather delightful on you. No need to act like you don't already know that though. #youknowyoulookgood ğŸ˜˜

Early this morning, this little noodle and I dropped off my dear friend, and his auntie, @fellowpassengers at the airport because she's headed to Thailand for the next few months. It was a sad moment for Tooney because he absolutely adores her. He must have stared out the window like this for about 5 minutes after she walked away. ğŸ’” #ugh #myheart #wewillmissyouauntie ğŸ˜˜
Ouch! My heart hurts over this precious #tunainterpretations created by the talented @elisavetarai. Thank you Elisaveta! It's so so so sweet. ğŸ˜ #tunartuesdays #tunameltsmyheart
Not only is #newnewcolin Tuna's latest companion that he likes to occasionally rough-house, (see exhibit a ğŸ‘†: torn mouth) but apparently, he also serves as a headrest. #multipurposed
I asked him to look at me and smile for the camera but I don't think he got the memo for the first instruction. That, or he was intentionally ignoring me. Knowing Tuna, the latter sounds accurate.

Tuna once asked me if we could get two double beds so that he could romp around like a crazy person with all of his toys. Unfortunately, the answer was no, so we compromised with a hotel room ğŸ˜œ #morningshenaniganswithnewnewcolin ğŸµ: day 'n' nite (crookers remix)

So basically this is how we have been spending most of our time over the past couple of days. It's really really good to be home with this little #toodlebrain snuggled up beside me. #bestillmyheart ğŸ˜

I recorded Tuna's reaction to my homecoming last night after being out of town for a while. I don't want to make any assumptions, but I think that he secretly kind of missed me...just a little bit, and not secretly ğŸ˜ ps. Let's just pretend that the lyrics say "I've been thinking bout you." ğŸ˜œ It's the best I could do without choosing the obvious: "Reunited"
Yes we 100% FaceTime while I'm out of town, and yes he 100% insists on showing off the majority of the time. #buttintheairdontcare

Sorry for the infrequent posts lately but I'm out of town. Tuna, very unfortunately, couldn't come with me this trip, so his trusty Uncle @mattvaughan is looking after him while I'm gone, and he is having so much fun! See ğŸ‘†. He's having the time of his life! ğŸ˜ƒ #derp #toodlebrain #shrivelneck

Ok. One more name fact. Some of you may have originally referred to or recognized Tuna as "Phteven". That was not a name given by me, but it has become his alter ego over the past few years after someone created a meme out of a photo of him similar to the drawing aboveğŸ‘†. If you google "Phteven" you can see the origin behind the meme ğŸ˜„. Thank you @mightypit for this delightful #tunainterpretations. The tunafish wallpaper is a nice touch! #phteven #tunartuesdays #tunameltsmyheart

So here's another fun fact about Tuna's name. His middle name is Marie. I realize that's it's a female name and he's a male, but to be honest, I just really like how it sounds together. Also it's my mom's middle name, as well as my best friend's middle name, so it has sentimental meaning for me. Plus he really likes it, which is all that actually matters. ğŸ˜œ #tunaloveshismiddlename #shrivelneck @courtneymarie2

I have noticed that a lot of you have asked "Why is his name Tuna?" Well, let me dispel any rumors that he is named after the fish :) When I adopted him at 4 months, I thought that he resembled Mr. Burns from the Simpsons (see exhibit A ğŸ‘†) so that is what became his name

I wanted to take a moment to acknowledge all one million of you-which blows me away to even say that!!! I am beyond grateful for this supportive community, and my heart is overwhelmed with gratitude every time I think of your adoration for Tuna. You are all so amazing! Thank you as always for loving Tuna as much as you do, and for following our daily adventures. ğŸ˜˜ #youallmeltmyheart #tunameltsmyheart

After scouring the park 3 times, I was unable to find Colin, so I immediately ordered Tuna a replacement. However, I was desperate to get the original one back for Tuna's sake, so I posted this missing persons sign at a park. Thankfully, the following day, I was contacted by a woman who explained that her Golden Retriever, Bronze, "retrieved" Colin and brought him back to their home with them. She of course returned him, so now Tuna has #oldcolin and #newcolin :) #hoorayforawesomepeople @monster_factory

This amazing artist has an incredible story and journey! @challmanportraits was in a near fatal snow mobile accident in 2005 that left her paralyzed from the waist down, and she lost parts of her four fingertips on her right hand due to frostbite. Overtime, she persevered through it, picked up a brush and began painting! Kris is an advocate for animal rescue so she mainly specializes in pet portraits. She decided to paint this classic #tunainterpretations, which some of you may recognize as Tuna's alter ego, Phteven :) Thank you again @challmanportriats for not giving up on your artistic talent even when the odds were against you! #tunartuesdays

Dearest friends. I'm typically very specific about the type of the photographs I post of Tuna, namely, clarity is very important to me. However, every so often I capture a brilliant photo of Tuna flinching, and they typically turn out to be some of my most favorite photos of him. I've refrained from posting them in order to preserve the standard of quality I'd like to keep, but I'm throwing that out the window. I can no longer bear to laugh out loud by myself any longer. Therefore, I'm inviting you to accompany me in my joy. From now on, you will periodically see a new series of posts appropriately named: #blurrytuna. Cheers!

In addition to the meet-and-greets, we held 3 benefit dinners while on #thetunatour to help raise additional funds for rescue groups/shelters. 16 artists from all over the world, who have created #tunainterpretations for #tunartuesdays in the past, generously donated their art to help support the cause! From the generosity of the artists and the bidders, we were able to raise $3,000 during the silent auctions at the dinners! Thank you again to everyone who participated, and a special thanks to @monacochicago in Chicago, @barkbox in New York and @theellishotel in Atlanta for hosting the dinners! #youallmeltmyheart! Above art by @cartoondan123

Well folks...#thetunatour is complete and my heart is so full! Thank you so much for those of you who came out to the meet-and-greets and to the benefit dinners, including our special friends @chimi_n_ella (^^^) It was so lovely meeting all of you! I am so humbled and grateful for all of your support, for your love for Tuna, and for your incredible generosity to benefit the city shelters. A huge thank you to @barkbox for partnering with us on this tour, and for helping us raise awareness and funds for the shelters! Throughout the tour, Barkbox has generously donated $15 from each box to "The Tuna Tour Rescue Fund", plus 10% off for you! After Friday, we will be splitting the money among the 8 city shelters! Please visit www.barkbox.com/tuna or the link in Tuna's bio to support the paws!

Just in case you were wondering if you were ever going to get the treat that I'm dangling above your head, the answer is absolutely yes! You deserve 87 million treats but you definitely won't be getting that many :/ #thankyouforbeingthebestpassenger

We are going on an 8-city, East Coast charitable meet-and-greet tour with @barkbox one week from today! In addition to the M+G, we are having 3 benefit dinners in Chicago, NYC, and Atlanta. During those dinners, there will be a silent auction featuring amazing art that was donated by #tunartuesday artists, in addition to other goodies! All money raised at those dinners will benefit those 3 city shelters! For more info or to get a ticket, please visit the link in my bio or www.tunameltsmyheart.com/benefit-dinners. Seats are limited! @katiekellyart is an incredible artist that draws for Disney, and this beautiful #tunainterpretations will be just one of many available to bid on during the dinners.

Today's activity:

I have noticed that a lot of you have asked "Why is his name Tuna?" Well, let me dispel any rumors that he is named after the fish :) When I adopted him at 4 months, I thought that he resembled Mr. Burns from the Simpsons, so that is what became his name
What began as a routine coffee break, turned into a pretty rad impromptu photoshoot starring Tuna and auntie @karadykert's cool cheetah pants. sometimesthebestthingsinlifearespontaneous

Today we went over to our new friend's house for a surprise visit, and shortly after we were there, her (dog) nephew came over to play with Tuna too, which turned out to be a big surprise for him! I think this was the first time that he ever hung out with a dog triple his size, hence the surprise. #youcantellbythelookonhisface #theoddcouple #jakethegermanshepherd @britsy_c @karadykert

I am so honored that the talented @soshabusha has drawn multiple #tunainterpretations of my little guy over the past few months. Each one of them are inspired by Tuna's photographs and they are wonderful! I wanted to honor Sonya this #tunartuesdays for her incredible talent! #tunameltsmyheart #sonyameltsmyheart

As most of you know, this little #toodlebrain is a rescue pup, and the charm that he is wearing around his neck is an indication of that :) The WagAware Charm is the only charm that saves animals lives because when a charm is purchased, they donate 50% to shelters, rescue groups and animal welfare charities! Instead, we should be mindful to be loving others with excellence everyday! #celebratethepoweroflove

We're on our way back home now but we had a lovely couple of days in Cleveland with our family and friends. A special thanks to all of you wonderful ones for coming out to @petco yesterday to meet Tuna! It was so fun! #youallmeltmyheart #travelingtunameltsmyheart :)

Update on @chimi_n_ella. I woke up to an encouraging text from his owner Jessica and this is an excerpt of it: "I have amazing news. Since all these prayers have poured in over the last 12 hours, Chimi has been practically healed overnight!" I called her right after I received the text and she shared with me that she is so overwhelmed by all of your support, contributions and prayers! Thank you for being an awesome community of people who band together to bless a stranger :) I think you all are really fantastic!! #lovingotherswithexcellence

caption: The mother of this adorable dog posted this precious picture under the hashtag #tunameltsmyheart earlier. I read the caption and clicked on his page only to discover that this dog is in critical condition from having a bad reaction to an IV injection. I got in contact with Chimi's mom, Jessica, and she sounded so broken on the phone as she shared his story and the events leading up to this traumatic experience. The nature of the images are graphic and heartbreaking but this precious dog is suffering and I feel compelled to share his story with you. As a dog mother, my heart breaks for the Jessica and her pup  @chimi_n_ella.

username: This will be a temporary post but I wanted to create awareness for sweet little Chimi and ask for your prayers and encouragement to send to Jessica during this trying time. Thank you in advance!"

caption: This handsome young man is kicking off Halloween week in style with his new @crazyrebels trick-or-treat bandana. I feel like I may need to clarify a little bit about yesterday's post. That photo and the story was from almost 3 years ago. I posted it for #flashbackfriday. I am not giving him up for adoption so don't fret. #hewasmeanttobemine :)

As most of you know, Tuna is a rescue. What you may not know is my foster time was cut short due to a pre-planned trip. My friend and neighbor @sarahpourshdesigns sent me this (adorable) photo of him that she took right before he was returned to his rescuer.

hashtags: I called the rescuer and told her that I had fallen in love but wasn't sure if I was in the position to adopt. She said that if he wasn't adopted by the following Sunday or if the Farmers Market got cancelled due to rain
type: I could foster him for another week to decide if I wanted to adopt him.

username: Well it torrential downpoured so much the night before that the FM got rained out and the rest is history :) #itrarelyrainswhereimfrom #howdoyoulikethemapples? #fbf #babytuna"

Yesterday I picked up Colin from the woman whose dog brought him home from the park. We ended up spending the afternoon together with her and her babies at the beach. Cheers to happy endings and new friendships!! #bronzeisthebest!

Today is a very sad day for Tuna and I. His auntie, and my best friend of 20 years, left this morning for her new home in Chicago :( #whaa. We will miss you so much @courtneymarie2 but we are excited for you more than anything! We love and cherish you! #friendofmyheart #bestiessince12

This is the first photo that I posted of Tuna back in Nov 2011. #tbt :) I didn't have an agenda when I joined Instagram, but I quickly acknowledged that IG was a platform that could bring people joy and laughter through Tuna's comical expressions. That became my mission :) A photo-a-day, and over a year later, I never would have anticipated or expected the kind of reaction that I've received. I am so encouraged by all of his followers who shower his page with love and affirmation. It really blesses me :) So I wanted to thank all of you for being so incredible, for your kind words and for loving Tuna so much! I also wanted to thank the folks at IG for allowing me the opportunity to make an impact on people's hearts from every continent. I am so grateful for that and for this wonderful community. #InstagramMeansToMe #tunameltsmyheart

caption: Thank you so much for your awesome comments! I try my best to read all of them but sometimes I'm unaware if you left one on an older post. Additionally, I apologize that I'm not able to respond them all :( However, please be assured that your love for Tuna really really melts my heart!!! On another note, here's a question that I see a lot of: "What is wrong with his face?" Hilarious. So basically it's congenial, meaning he was born with a shorter lower jaw. NBD. It's just one of the many reasons why we all love him so much! Here's a close-up :) #tunameltsmyheart

So here's a fun fact about Tuna. I originally named him Mr. Burns, per the uncanny resemblance to Montgomery Burns, per the aggressive overbite and recessed lower jawline dysfunction (see his old tag above ^.) Shortly after I nicknamed him Tooney (short for cartoon) and then it morphed into Tuna, which is now his official name. #doppelgÃ¤nger #tbt

Time for your close up Mr. Tuna. #headshot

Here's the scoop on Tuna: This "adorable" chiweenie was formally a shivering orphan but when he was 3mos, he became my son :) Can you imagine nobody wanting him? Rude. Breaks my little heart :( My theory is he was rejected because he has an aggressive, congenial lower jawline dysfunction which is unarguable his best feature :) I originally named him Mr. Burns (per the uncanny resemblance to Montgomery Burns...per the overbite) so organically I began to call him Tooney (short for cartoon) but that eventually turned into Tuna (which is now his official name :) His best friend is an emo alien doll named Colin and his other best friends are his cousin Ralph and his step brother Frankie. You'll be seeing more of them. Lastly but not leastly, Tuna is incredibly amazing, has the sweetest personality and is super lovable! I am so grateful that you all like him so much and I hope that he continues to bring everyone of you A TON of joy and laughter!!! Thanks for following!
